title: Britain's Got Talent: The Champions' Bello and Annaliese Nock 'most dange
text:
Amanda Holden revealed the most dangerous act in Britain’s Got Talent history (Picture: ITV)

Amanda Holden brands Bello and Annaliese Nock the most dangerous act in Britain’s Got Talent history.

The father-daughter daredevil duo landed in the final thanks to their death-defying stunts that left everyone hiding behind their hands.

And the judge reveals their terrifying performance had her on the edge of her seat, in tonight’s instalment.

Which only had a little something to do with the intricate gown she rocks on the night.

The 48-year-old tells them: ‘Oh, my God! That, more than anything I’ve seen in the history of Britain’s Got Talent, which has been running for 13 seasons, was the most dangerous thing I have ever seen.

‘I literally, for the dress and other reasons, was on the edge of my seat.

‘You’re so brave!’

While Simon is left similarly breathless by the act, and takes a second to check his heart rate before telling the pair they deserve to be in the final.

Bello and Annaliese Nock left us all terrified (Picture: ITV)

The father and daughter came to fame after they competed on America’s Got Talent as solo acts, with stuntman Bello starring in season 12, back in 2017.

Keen to show off her own abilities, Annaliese popped up a year later, before they decided to team up and stress us all out even more.

But have Bello and Annaliese done enough to be crowned champions?

Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions The Final airs tonight at 8.30pm on ITV.
